translation: Mūlasarvâstivāda-bhikṣuṇīvinaya

source_sentence: 卷第二
translation: vol. 2

source_sentence: 三藏法師義淨奉　制譯
translation: Translation by the Tripiṭaka Master Yijing Feng

source_sentence: 不淨行學處之餘
translation: apart from the training ground of impure practices

source_sentence: 爾時薄伽梵，為迦攝波宣暢法要，示教利喜已從座而去。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān declared the essentials of the Dharma for Kāśyapa, showed him the benefits of his teaching, and departed from his seat.

source_sentence: 時具壽摩訶迦攝波隨從佛去，作如是念：「若佛坐時，我當奉此僧伽胝衣疊以充座。」
translation: Kauśāmbī followed the Buddha and had this thought, "When the Buddha sits here, I'll present this pile of saṃghâṭī robes to fill my seat."

source_sentence: 是時便有五百群賊，隨逐其後欲為劫奪。
translation: Then, a group of 500 thieves followed behind them, intending to plunder them.

source_sentence: 世尊知已於路側欲坐，時迦攝波往世尊處，速即疊衣為佛敷座。
translation: When the Bhagavān knew that they were about to sit on the side of the road, Kāśyapa went to the Bhagavān and quickly folded his robe to make a seat for the Buddha.

source_sentence: 世尊便坐，即命迦攝波曰：「此布僧伽胝，極是輕妙極是柔軟。」
translation: The Bhagavān then sat down and instructed Kāśyapa, "This cloth is extremely light and delicate, and it's extremely soft."

source_sentence: 白言：「如是世尊！
translation: He said, "So it is, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此衣實是輕軟，願哀納受。」
translation: This robe is really light and soft; have mercy and accept it."

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「汝能著我麻糞掃衣不？」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "Will you put on my linen duster?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「唯願世尊哀愍我故為受輕衣，世尊所賜麻糞掃衣我當披服。」
translation: He answered, "Please have mercy on me, Bhagavān, and accept this light robe, which the Bhagavān has given me to wear as a linen duster."

source_sentence: 是時世尊哀愍為受。
translation: The Bhagavān then kindly accepted it for me.

source_sentence: 時迦攝波如是次第，於八日中無所證獲，乞食自持，至第九日得阿羅漢果。
translation: Kāśyapa then did so in turn, attaining nothing for eight days, begging for food and maintaining it on his own until the ninth day, when he attained the fruit of the arhat.

source_sentence: 爾時妙賢，既無所依不閑時務，但覩外相便生敬重，遂詣無衣外道而為出家。
translation: At the time, Marvelous Goodness, having no support and no leisure time to devote to her duties, simply looked at her external appearance and became respectful, so she went to a monk without clothes and became a renunciant.

source_sentence: 此女容儀端正無匹，外道既見咸生染心，雖極厭污不能遠離，遂被五百無衣外道共行非法。
translation: This woman's appearance was so correct and unmatched that when the non-Buddhists saw her, they all became defiled and couldn't get away from her, even though they were extremely disgusted with her defilement.

source_sentence: 妙賢罵曰：「仁等作此鄙惡之行，豈成修道。」
translation: Myōkai reprimanded them, "How could you cultivate your religious practice if you did such despicable things?"

source_sentence: 女身柔軟，既被輕辱受苦難堪，即以其事告無衣外道女。
translation: The woman, who was tender and gentle, was embarrassed by the slight humiliation she received, so she told the nondressed laywomen about it.

source_sentence: 諸女答曰：「汝可往詣大師晡刺拏處具述斯事。」
translation: The women replied, "You may go to the master Asaṅga and tell him about it."

source_sentence: 女聞此教，便詣師所禮雙足已，作如是言：「我今遭厄極受辛苦，幸願慈悲曲垂恩濟。」
translation: After hearing this teaching, she bowed her feet to the master and said, "I've been subjected to terrible hardship, so please be merciful and extend your kindness."

source_sentence: 彼便報曰：「我由斯眾恭敬尊重多獲利養，如其制約悉皆分散，令我門徒遂成衰減，任隨彼意我不能知。」
translation: She then replied, "I've gained much benefit from this group of people who respect and venerate me, and as a result of their regulations, they've all been scattered, causing my disciples to decline, and I can't know whether to follow their wishes."

source_sentence: 既見慇懃遂行泥印，令二百五十人以為番次，時此女人稍減憂惱。
translation: Seeing this kindness, he applied his clay seal and caused 250 people to take their place, and the woman was then slightly less troubled.

source_sentence: 其王舍城有歡會事，妙賢乃與露形外道一處隨行。
translation: When there was a joyful gathering in Rājagṛha, Marvelous Virtue followed it with a group of outsiders who had revealed their forms.

source_sentence: 時迦攝波於王舍城，在阿蘭若小室中住，於日初分執持衣鉢，入城乞食忽見妙賢，問言：「賢首！
translation: Kāśyapa was staying in a small room in Araṇḍa in Rājagṛha at the beginning of the day, and when he gathered his robe and bowl and went into the city to solicit alms, he suddenly saw Miaoxian and asked, "Good man!

source_sentence: 汝比頗得安樂而住，修淨行不？」
translation: Will you, sir, be able to live in comfort and cultivate pure practices?"

source_sentence: 是時妙賢見迦攝波，涕泣盈目悲不自持，飲淚言曰：「與誰為伴？
translation: When Marvelous Goodness saw Kāśyapa, his eyes filled with tears and pity, he drank tears and said, "Who will be my companion?

source_sentence: 欲於何處修淨行耶？
translation: Where do you want to cultivate pure practices?

source_sentence: 昔我與仁居一柱觀，十二年內堅修妙業，淨行嚴潔始終不踰。
translation: In the past, I lived with my friend in a pillar of meditation, cultivating marvelous activities for twelve years, and my pure conduct was scrupulous and unexcelled in the end.

source_sentence: 初無染心以手相觸，一從乖異濫投於此，雜穢群聚事同畜生，不成出家何有淨行？」
translation: At first, our undefiled minds touched each other with our hands, but once we diverged from one to the other and indiscriminately threw ourselves into this place, our affairs were like those of animals, and we didn't become renunciant; how could there be pure practices?"

source_sentence: 時迦攝波重問其故，妙賢致敬猶如慈父，以事白知。
translation: Kāśyapa then repeatedly asked him about the reason, and Marvelous Goodness paid homage as if he were a loving father and explained the matter to him.

source_sentence: 彼作是念：「此女頗有宿善根不？」
translation: He thought, "Does this woman have some long-standing good roots?"

source_sentence: 斂念觀已知有解脫分善根，「誰當濟度？」
translation: A recitation contemplates the good roots of the known portion of liberation, "Who will save them?"

source_sentence: 知屬於己，報言：「賢首！
translation: Those who know that they belong to him say, "Good man!

source_sentence: 何不於此善說法律而為出家？」
translation: Why don't you explain the Dharma well and become a renunciant?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「聖者！
translation: He replied, "Sage!

source_sentence: 勿令此中還傳印法。」
translation: Don't let the seal of the Dharma be transmitted back here."

source_sentence: 答言：「止！
translation: He replied, "Stop!

source_sentence: 止！
translation: Stop!

source_sentence: 賢首！
translation: Xianshou!

source_sentence: 勿作是說，今我大師萬德圓滿滅一切障，是真福田是歸依處，微妙寂靜證真解脫，豈容將彼極下劣法而相比耶？」
translation: Don't say that, for now my great teacher, with all his virtues perfectly extinguished, is truly a field of merit and a place of refuge, and he has achieved true liberation with subtle tranquility, how could he compare himself to that extremely inferior teaching?"

source_sentence: 妙賢聞已歡喜隨行，遂將妙賢付大世主，告言：「聖者！
translation: After hearing this, Myōkai rejoiced and went along with him. He then entrusted Myōkai to the Lord of the World and told him, "Sage!

source_sentence: 此妙賢女心欣勝法，極善作意，可與出家。」
translation: This wonderful woman's heart yearns for the surpassing Dharma and is extremely well-intended, so she can be allowed to leave home."

source_sentence: 時大世主敬受其教，即便與彼五衣等物，授諸學處及近圓已，告曰：「汝今宜可於佛境界乞食資身善修淨行。」
translation: The Mahādeva accepted his teaching with respect, and even after he had given her five robes and other things, given her places of training, and approached completion, he told her, "Now, it would be good for you to go to the Buddha's realm to solicit food to support yourself and to cultivate good and pure practices."

source_sentence: 是時妙賢於日初分，執持衣鉢入城乞食。
translation: At the beginning of the day, that wonderful woman took her robe and bowl into the city to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 時此女人儀貌端正人間希有，眾人見時共生嗟歎：「何意此女姿態絕倫，虛棄年華不受欲樂，能捨榮好而為出家？」
translation: When the woman's appearance was so fine that it was rare among people, the crowd looked at her and admired her, "Why is this woman so despised for her appearance, forsaking youth and pleasure, and forsaking honor and beauty to leave home?"

source_sentence: 妙賢聞已遂生慚恥，自是之後不復入城而為乞食。
translation: After hearing this, Marvelous Goodness became ashamed and didn't go back into the city to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 時迦攝波因與相見，問曰：「賢首！
translation: Kāśyapa then met him and asked, "Good man!

source_sentence: 得安樂不？」
translation: Will you attain peace and comfort?"

source_sentence: 妙賢具答，彼聞說已作如是語：「若佛許我乞食減半與妙賢者，我當分與。」
translation: After he heard what he said, Miaoxian answered in full, saying, "If the Buddha approves of my begging for food and reduces it by half, I will share it with Miaoxian."

source_sentence: 白諸苾芻，苾芻白佛，佛言：「隨意與半。」
translation: He told the monks, who then told the Buddha, "Give half as you like."

source_sentence: 尊者聞已授其半食以相拯濟。
translation: After hearing this, the Venerable gave him half of the food to save him.

source_sentence: 時吐羅難陀尼見斯事已遂生輕笑，謗言：「聖者大迦攝波先與妙賢居一柱觀，十二年中淨修梵行，乃於今日翻有私情，乞食相濟。」
translation: Seeing this, the Tūranandana nuns then laughed lightly and said, "The noble man Mahākāśyapa was staying with that wonderful man at One Pillar Meditation for 12 years, purifying his religious practice, and now he's turning over a personal favor and begging for food to help him."

source_sentence: 時迦攝波聞斯事已，至妙賢處教其法要：「此事應作、此不應作，宜善用心。」
translation: After Kāśyapa heard this, he went to Marvelous Virtue and taught him the essentials of the Dharma, "This is something you should do; this is not something you should do; you should pay good attention to it."

source_sentence: 遂捨而去。
translation: He then abandoned them and departed.

source_sentence: 是時妙賢發大勇猛，於初後夜正念相應，尅責自心無暫停息，即便證得阿羅漢果，轉成清淨無生之女。
translation: Subsequently, Miaoxian aroused great courage, correctly associated himself with mindfulness during the first and last nights, resolutely rebuked his own mind without pausing, and even then realized the fruit of the arhat, transforming into a pure, unborn woman.

source_sentence: 爾時迦攝波見而告曰：「汝今由我善知識故，其所作者皆已作訖，宜於佛境界乞食自資。」
translation: Kāśyapa then saw and told her, "Now that you've finished working on your task because of my good friend, it's time to beg for food in the Buddha's realm."

source_sentence: 是時妙賢於日初分，執持衣鉢入王舍城次第乞食。
translation: At the beginning of the day, Miaoxian took his robe and bowl and entered Rājagṛha in order to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 時未生怨王枉殺其父，生大追悔懷憂在室。
translation: At the time, the unborn resentful king had wrongfully killed his father and was in his room with great remorse and sorrow.

source_sentence: 雖有種種鼓樂弦歌，無釋愁惱。
translation: Although he had various drums, music, strings, and songs, they didn't relieve his grief.

source_sentence: 時彼大臣遇見妙賢儀貌端正容色殊勝，便作是念：「今此美女特異常人，宜可進王冀除憂慼。」
translation: When that minister met Myōhyeon, he saw her with her correct demeanor and excellent appearance and thought, "Now, this beautiful woman is special and unusual; it would be a good idea to enter the king's chamber to remove his grief."

source_sentence: 作是念已將近王室，強逼妙賢脫去法衣，著諸彩服具備瓔珞塗拭名香，令親侍人進至王所。
translation: After thinking this, he approached the king's quarters, forced Myōsan to remove her Dharma robes, put on colorful clothing, put on jewelry, and smeared it with a famous scent, and had his attendants enter the king's quarters.

source_sentence: 時未生怨王纔觀此女姿容妙絕，遂釋憂懷。
translation: The king, who hadn't yet arisen from enmity, then took a rare look at this woman's beautiful appearance and released his grief.

source_sentence: 復由妙賢惡業時熟，如瀑流水無能止遏，遂被惡王強見陵辱，如中毒箭生大憂苦。
translation: Furthermore, because of the ripening of her bad karma, which is like a raging current that can't be stopped, she was forced by the evil king to look at her and humiliate her, which was like being shot with a poisoned arrow and caused great sorrow and suffering.

source_sentence: 是時大世主於十五日欲褒灑陀，遍觀尼眾不見妙賢，入定觀知在王宮內遭大辛苦非常被辱。
translation: On the fifteenth day, the Mahādeva-rāja wanted to visit Sādha, and when he looked around the nuns and didn't see Marvelous Virtue, he entered into meditation and observed that he had been subjected to great hardship and extreme humiliation inside the king's palace.

source_sentence: 諸尼問言：「聖者！
translation: The nuns asked, "Sage!

source_sentence: 妙賢今何所在，獨不見耶？」
translation: Where is Myōkhyō now, having failed to see him?"

source_sentence: 時大世主即便命彼蓮花色尼曰：「汝應斂念觀彼妙賢。」
translation: Even then, the Mahādeva commanded that lotus-colored nun, "Recuperate and observe that Bhadraśriputra."

source_sentence: 既聞語已觀知所在，猶如壯士屈伸臂頃，於尼眾沒王宮中出，在高樓上空中而住，遙告妙賢曰：「姊妹！
translation: After hearing those words, he observed where he was, and like a strong man with his arms bent outstretched, he emerged from the nuns' crowded palace, stayed up in the air on a high building, and told Marvelous Virtuous from a distance, "Sister!

source_sentence: 汝已能破諸煩惱魔，何不發起大神通事，受斯陵辱？」
translation: You've been able to dispel the demons of affliction, so why don't you do something of great supernormal power and accept this humiliation?"

source_sentence: 時蓮花色尼便授其法，如是應作如是應修，速自調心發起通力。
translation: The Lotus Sainika then instructed him in the teaching, "Thus should you do and thus should you practice, and quickly tame your mind and give rise to supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 是時妙賢繫念除亂，於須臾間獲得神足，著俗彩衣乘空而去。
translation: Miaoxian then freed himself from mental disturbances, and in a moment's time attained miraculous abilities, put on his secular colored robes, and rode off into the sky.

source_sentence: 時蓮花色便共妙賢至長淨處，時十二眾苾芻尼，見已生大嫌恥，作輕笑言：「我實不能與此宮人同處長淨。」
translation: The lotus then took Miaoxian with her to a place of great purity, where twelve bhikṣuṇīs saw her and became greatly ashamed, laughing and saying, "I really can't share the same abode of purity as this man of the palace."

source_sentence: 時大世主聞斯語已，告妙賢曰：「具壽！
translation: After the Mahādeva heard this, he told Miaoxian, "Guishou!

source_sentence: 宜往白王，著先法服速還來此。」
translation: You should go to the king and tell him to put on his previous robes and quickly come back here."

source_sentence: 于時妙賢即乘神通至王寢處，其王猶睡，在於空中彈指作聲。
translation: At that point, Marvelous Virtuous then rode his psychic powers to the king's sleeping quarters while he was still asleep, snapping his fingers in the air and making noises.

source_sentence: 王聞覺已，便大驚怖身毛皆竪，作如是言：「汝為是誰？
translation: When the king heard and realized it, he was terrified, and his hair stood on end, saying, "Who are you?

source_sentence: 為天龍耶？
translation: Are these the dragons of heaven?

source_sentence: 為神鬼耶？」
translation: Are they gods and spirits?"

source_sentence: 作是語已，是時妙賢空中對曰：「我非天龍神鬼等，但是大師聲聞眾中妙賢苾芻尼。」
translation: After he said this, that was when Marvelous Goodness answered in the air, "I'm not a god, dragon, spirit, or other spirit, but a Marvelous Goodness monk or nun among the great teachers and śrāvakas."

source_sentence: 時王聞已以頌答曰：「現無法衣并應器，　　容狀復不似尼形；　相貌既同倡艷女，　　法俗相違當為說。」
translation: After the king heard this, he replied with a verse, "Now, I have no Dharma robe or utensils, and my appearance doesn't resemble that of a nun; my features are the same as those of a beautiful woman, and I will explain the difference between the conventional and the Dharma."

source_sentence: 是時妙賢縱身而下，以事告曰：「大王非理相陵逼，　　強奪我鉢并法衣；　宜應見授父母財，　　我欲速歸為長淨。」
translation: Myōkai then descended from his body and told him, "The king has unreasonably oppressed me, forcing me to take my bowl and Dharma robe; it's time to see my parents' wealth and grant it to them, and I want to quickly return to them for their long-term purification."

source_sentence: 時未生怨王聞是語已，悶絕躄地。
translation: After hearing those words, the king of the unborn resentments became despondent and fell to the ground.

source_sentence: 以冷水灑面方能醒悟，便禮雙足求哀致謝，即索衣鉢敬授妙賢。
translation: He sprinkled his face with cold water before he could awaken, then saluted him with his feet, begged for his pity, and asked for his robe and bowl to give to Marvelous Virtuous.

source_sentence: 既受得已即還本處，與諸尼眾而為長淨。
translation: After accepting it, he returned to his original place and gave it to the nuns for a long time to purify.

source_sentence: 爾時諸苾芻尼以妙賢事告諸苾芻，苾芻白佛。
translation: The nuns then told the monks about Myohyeon, and the monks said to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 世尊以此因緣集苾芻尼，諸佛常法知而故問、依時問非時不問、有利問非利不問、破決隄防為除疑惑，告妙賢苾芻尼曰：「汝實作斯不端嚴事耶？」
translation: The Bhagavān gathered the bhikṣuṇīs for this reason, knowing the constant Dharma of the buddhas and therefore asking questions, asking questions at appropriate times and not at appropriate times, asking questions that are beneficial and not beneficial, and breaking the barrier to remove doubt, he told the monks and nuns of Miaoxian, "Have you really done such an improper and adorned thing?"

source_sentence: 白言：「實爾。
translation: I said, "It's true.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 世尊復問：「汝受樂不？」
translation: The Bhagavān again asked, "Do you experience pleasure?"

source_sentence: 白言：「世尊！
translation: They said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我已離欲豈容受樂？」
translation: How can I be free of desire and still experience pleasure?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝今無犯，然苾芻尼作不淨行，犯波羅市迦。
translation: The Buddha said, "Now, you've done nothing wrong, but a monk or nun who does an impure act commits a misdeed called a prāsāka.

source_sentence: 如蘇陣那。
translation: It's like Sudinna.

source_sentence: 我觀十利廣說如上，乃至顯揚正法廣利人天，為諸聲聞苾芻尼弟子，於毘奈耶中制其學處，應如是說：「若復苾芻尼，與諸苾芻尼同得學處，不捨學處、學羸不自說，作不淨行兩交會法，乃至共傍生，此苾芻尼亦得波羅市迦不應共住。」
translation: I've observed the ten benefits and explained them in detail as above, even to the point of proclaiming the right teaching for the benefit of humans and gods, and I will define the place of training in Vinaya for disciples of śrāvaka bhikṣuṇīs, saying, "If another bhikṣuṇī attains the place of training together with other bhikṣuṇīs, doesn't abandon the place of training, doesn't explain the weakness of their training, engages in impure behavior, and meets the Dharma in two ways, even if they are born together as an animal, this bhikṣuṇī will also attain the status of a prātimokṣa and shouldn't live together."

source_sentence: 若復苾芻尼者，有其五種：一、名字苾芻尼，二、自言苾芻尼，三、乞求苾芻尼，四、破煩惱苾芻尼，五、白四羯磨苾芻尼。
translation: Again, there are five kinds of bhikṣuṇīs: 1. nominal bhikṣuṇīs, 2. self-proclaimed bhikṣuṇīs, 3. begging bhikṣuṇīs, 4. affliction-busting bhikṣuṇīs, and 5. four bhikṣuṇīs who confess their intentions.

source_sentence: 名字苾芻尼者，如人立字名作苾芻尼、或世共許、或是苾芻尼種族，因此喚為苾芻尼，是謂名字苾芻尼。
translation: A monk who names himself a monk is called a monk by name, such as a person who names himself a monk, gives his name in common with the world, or is from a monk's family, and thus calls himself a monk.

source_sentence: 云何自言苾芻尼？
translation: How does he call himself a bhikṣuṇī?

source_sentence: 若人實非苾芻尼，自言我是苾芻尼，或是賊住等自稱苾芻尼，是謂自言苾芻尼。
translation: If a person really isn't a monk and says, "I'm a monk," or if a thief or someone else claims to be a monk, this is called calling oneself a monk.

source_sentence: 長者與諸家眷出遊芳園，佛不在世獨覺出現，情懷哀愍，受下臥具為上福田，樂居閑靜不共俗交，如大犀牛離群獨住。
translation: When the elder and his family went out to the fragrant garden, the solitary realizer appeared in the absence of the Buddha, felt compassion, accepted the lower bedding as a superior field of merit, and lived in comfort and quietness without worldly interactions, like a great rhinoceros separated from its herd and living alone.

source_sentence: 時彼獨覺於芳園所樹下而坐，時彼長者將妻既至林中共其行欲，為色荒迷不見大士。
translation: That pratyekabuddha was sitting under a tree in the fragrant garden when that man's wife arrived in the forest to share his desires, and they were confused by sex and didn't see the great man.

source_sentence: 獨覺聞聲從定而起，長者遂見獨覺，深起羞慚情生悔謝，為設供養合掌發願：『我作惡事皆由耽欲，願我二人當來俱得少欲果報。』
translation: When the pratyekabuddha heard the sound, he got up from his meditation, and the elder then saw the pratyekabuddha, felt a deep sense of shame and remorse, made offerings, put his palms together, and vowed, 'All the bad things I've done were caused by my indulgence in desire, may we both attain the fruit of few desires in the future.'

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻於意云何？
translation: What do you monks think?

source_sentence: 昔時長者豈異人乎？
translation: Wasn't the elder different from the others in the past?

source_sentence: 今具壽大迦攝波是，其妻即妙賢，由是發願故二俱少欲。」
translation: Now, Kauśāmbī's wife is Marvelous Goodness, and because of this vow, they both want less."

source_sentence: 諸苾芻曰：「希有世尊！
translation: The monks said, "It's rare, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 具壽大迦攝波及妙賢女二俱出家。」
translation: Kauṣṭhila Mahākāśyapa and Śubhavyūha left home with both of them."

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「非但今生二俱捨俗而為出家，乃往古昔亦復如是。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Not only have they both left secular life and become renunciant practitioners in this life, but they were likewise in the distant past.

source_sentence: 汝等諦聽，我為汝說。
translation: All of you, listen closely as I explain this for you.

source_sentence: 於婆羅痆斯城有一陶師，其作坊內有四獨覺來為求止宿。
translation: In the city of Vārāṇasī, there was a potter whose workshop housed four solitary realizers who came to seek lodging.

source_sentence: 時諸大士前後而至互不相知，時一獨覺入火光定遂即遙見，共相問曰：『仁今是誰？』
translation: When the great men arrived, they didn't know each other, but then one pratyekabuddha entered a fiery concentration and immediately saw them from a distance, and they all asked each other, 'Sir, who are you now?'

source_sentence: 一人答曰：『仁等頗聞有王名曰杖瓶，其王復有無量億千象兵圍繞不？』
translation: One man answered, 'Have you heard, Sir, that there's a king named Cane Vase, and that he's also surrounded by measureless hundreds of millions of elephant soldiers?'

source_sentence: 報言：『曾聞。』
translation: He replied, 'I've heard it before.'

source_sentence: 答言：『我是。』
translation: He replied, 'I have.'

source_sentence: 問曰：『仁緣何事而作出家？』
translation: He asked, 'For what reason did you renounce the world?'

source_sentence: 答言：『我在高樹乃見鵄鳥持肉而飛，群類隨從遞相爭擊。
translation: He replied, "I was up in a high tree when I saw a bird flying with its flesh in its hand, and a group of birds followed it and fought over it.

source_sentence: 鵄棄其肉而向一邊，其餘眾鳥共相牽掣。
translation: The owl threw away its meat and went to one side, and the other birds pulled at each other.

source_sentence: 我見斯事情生厭捨，作如是念：「何用如此無益之事？」
translation: Seeing this, I became disillusioned and thought, 'Why would I do such a useless thing?'"

source_sentence: 悉皆棄捨而為出家。
translation: They all abandoned them and became renunciant monks.

source_sentence: 復說頌曰：「『見彼鵄銜肉，　　眾鳥共交爭；　　棄之得安寧，　　是故捨榮位。
translation: Again, he spoke a verse, "Seeing that man holding his flesh in his mouth and the many birds fighting over it, he discards it and attains peace; therefore, he abandons his position of honor.

source_sentence: 欲念無真實，　　猶如夢想倒；　　獨步如犀牛，　　而在一邊住。』
translation: Thoughts of desire are unreal, like the falsity of a dream, and they walk alone like a rhinoceros while standing on one side.'

source_sentence: 「次問第二獨覺曰：『仁今是誰？』
translation: "Next, he asked the second pratyekabuddha, 'Sir, who is he now?'

source_sentence: 彼即答言：『仁等頗聞有王名曰醜面，其王復有無量億千馬兵圍繞不？』
translation: They then replied, 'Sir, have you heard that there's a king named Ugly Face and that he's surrounded by measureless hundreds of millions of horses and soldiers?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『曾聞。』
translation: He replied, 'I've heard it before.'

source_sentence: 報言：『我是。』
translation: And he replied, 'I have.'

source_sentence: 復問彼曰：『仁以何緣而作出家？』
translation: Again, he asked him, 'For what reason did you renounce the world?'

source_sentence: 答言：『我在宮中無量億千兵馬圍繞，見二特牛逐一牸牛，共相抵觸軀體傷損，一牛角折退走而去。
translation: He replied, "I was in my palace, surrounded by measureless hundreds of millions of troops and horses, when I saw two special bulls battling one cow, and they were both bruised and battered, while one of the bulls' horns broke and it retreated.

source_sentence: 我既見已情甚嗟歎，而作是念：「諸有過患，貪欲為本、心為惱害。」
translation: After I saw them, I was deeply moved and thought, 'All the faults and distress are rooted in desire, and the mind is an affliction.'

source_sentence: 深生厭患便即出家。
translation: Deeply disillusioned, he then left home.

source_sentence: 復說頌曰：「『我見二牛爭一牸，　　互相抵觸體損傷；　　一牛捨離得安寧，　　有情為欲常懷怖。
translation: Again, he spoke a verse, "I've seen two bulls fighting over a cow, and their bodies were injured when they came into contact with each other; one of the bulls abandoned it and attained peace, but sentient beings are always fearful because of their desires.

source_sentence: 我若犀牛恒獨步，　　閑曠安然住一邊；　　不為諸欲之所牽，　　得至自在無為處。』
translation: Were I a rhinoceros walking alone, I'd stay calm and peaceful on one side; not being tethered by desires, I'd attain a place of sovereign nonproductivity.'

source_sentence: 「次問第三獨覺曰：『仁今是誰？』
translation: "Next, he asked the third pratyekabuddha, 'Sir, who is he now?'

source_sentence: 彼即答言：『仁等頗聞婆羅痆斯城有王名曰梵授，其王復有無量億千人眾圍繞不？』
translation: They then replied, 'Have you heard, sir, that there's a king in Vārāṇasī named Brahmadatta, and that he's also surrounded by a multitude of measureless hundreds of millions of people?'

source_sentence: 答言：『曾聞。』
translation: He replied, 'I've heard it before.'

source_sentence: 報曰：『我是。』
translation: And he replied, 'I have.'

source_sentence: 問曰：『仁以何緣而作出家？』
translation: He asked, 'For what reason did you become a householder?'

source_sentence: 答言：『我因三春屆節百卉敷榮，茂林清池花鳥交映，孔雀、鸚鵡、鵝鴈、鴛鴦，雜類哀鳴群飛合響。
translation: He replied, "It's because of the three spring seasons that a hundred flowers bloom, and the lush forests and clear ponds are filled with flowers and birds, while peacocks, parrots, geese, and birds of prey all sing and fly together.

source_sentence: 我於一時與宮人婇女，嚴四兵眾出遊芳園，隨所周旋，與諸美女歡娛嬉戲飡美飲食，疲乏而臥。
translation: One time, I went out to the fragrant garden with my palace staff and the four decorated soldiers and went around, enjoying myself with beautiful women, eating and drinking delicious food, and lying down when I was tired.

source_sentence: 宮人縱逸貪愛花果，見我睡眠詣諸樹邊採花取果，摧殘樹枝悉令毀折。
translation: When the palace people indulged in their craving for flowers and fruits, they saw me sleeping and went to the trees to gather flowers and fruits, destroying their branches and breaking them.

source_sentence: 我見此已情甚憂歎，此樹向者花果枝葉滋榮欝茂，忽然凋落一至於此，我身亦爾此不須疑。
translation: I was so sad when I saw that, because this tree's flowers and fruit were flourishing and growing in branches and leaves, but suddenly they withered away once and for all, and there's no need to doubt that I'm the same.

source_sentence: 復作是念：「世間言論皆惱心神。」
translation: Again, they thought, "Worldly talk disturbs the mind and spirit."

source_sentence: 即皆棄捨所有國位而作出家。』
translation: They then all abandon their states and positions and leave home.'

source_sentence: 復說頌曰：「『我見眾香妙花樹，　　枝條毀折不堪觀，　　當知諸欲悉皆然，　　如彼犀牛應獨處。』
translation: Again, he spoke a verse, "I see a multitude of fragrant, marvelous flowering trees whose branches are broken and bent, and I can't stand to look at them. I should know that all desires are the same, just like that rhinoceros that should be left alone."

source_sentence: 「次問第四獨覺曰：『仁為是誰？』
translation: "Next, he asked the fourth pratyekabuddha, 'Ren, who is this?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『仁等頗聞於瓔珞城有王名曰壯勝，有無量億千人眾圍繞不？』
translation: He answered, 'Have you heard, sir, that there's a king in the city of Diadem named Jōshō who's surrounded by measureless hundreds of millions of people?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『曾聞。』
translation: He replied, 'I've heard it before.'

source_sentence: 報言：『我是。』
translation: And he replied, 'I have.'

source_sentence: 復問曰：『仁以何緣而作出家？』
translation: Again, he asked, 'For what reason did you become a householder?'

source_sentence: 答言：『我在宮中婇女圍繞，時有婇女臂著白螺貝玔，隨動手時其玔相擊作閙聲響。
translation: He replied, "When I was in the palace surrounded by women, there was a woman wearing a white conch and a conch ring on her arm, and when she moved her hand, the ring made a boisterous noise when it struck each other.

source_sentence: 我見斯事情生憂歎，此無有識，互相擊觸遂即作聲，況人共住豈得安靜。
translation: When I see that, I become sad and admire it, for there's no consciousness here, and it makes a noise when they touch each other, so how could there be peace when people live together?

source_sentence: 然復作是念：「世人祗接並惱心識。」
translation: Still, they think, "All people simply connect with and disturb the mind and consciousness."

source_sentence: 悉皆棄捨而作出家。』
translation: They all abandon them and make their homes.'

source_sentence: 復說頌曰：「『我見環玔莊嚴臂，　　互相掁觸出音聲；　　當知諸欲亦復然，　　應如野象孤行宿。』
translation: Again, he spoke a verse, "I see a ring of ornamented arms that make sounds when they touch each other; I should know that this is likewise with desires, for they should be like wild elephants walking alone for the night."

source_sentence: 「是時陶師聞諸大士說斯語已，妻告夫曰：『聖子！
translation: "After the potter heard these words from the great man, his wife told her husband, 'Noble son!

source_sentence: 此諸大仙皆是國王自在豪貴，棄捨榮位厭離世樂而作出家。
translation: These great men are all kings, comfortable and powerful, who renounce their positions of honor and become householders because they're disillusioned with worldly pleasures.

source_sentence: 我等何故不為出家？』
translation: Why don't we renounce our homes?'

source_sentence: 陶師二子復白父言：『若出家者，誰養我等？』
translation: The potter's two sons then said to their father, 'If we were to leave home, who would support us?'

source_sentence: 父曰：『子勿懷憂，待汝長大吾當出家。』
translation: The father said, 'Don't be concerned, son; when you grow up, I will leave home.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，陶師持瓶佯行取水，妻曰：『聖子！
translation: After he said this, the potter pretended to fetch water from a jar, and his wife said, 'Noble son!

source_sentence: 我去取水，何自疲勞？』
translation: Why am I so tired when I've gone to fetch water?'

source_sentence: 便奪夫瓶自往河所，置瓶于地而去出家。
translation: She then took her husband's vial and went to the river, put the vial on the ground, and left home.

source_sentence: 夫聞婦去，云：『我失計，今可安家養育子息。
translation: When the husband heard of the woman's departure, he said, 'I've lost my plan; now I can settle down and raise my children.

source_sentence: 年漸長大，試其善惡能自活不？』
translation: As he grows older, will he be able to test his goodness or badness and live on his own?'

source_sentence: 自飡鹽味與子淡食，自喫熟果授兒生者，子白父言：『我豈不欲飡鹽及以熟果，乃與淡生，云何可食？』
translation: A person who gives his son a light meal by tasting salt and gives him raw food by eating ripe fruit says to his father, 'Wouldn't I like to eat salt and ripe fruit, but give him a light meal?'

source_sentence: 陶師作念：『二子已知醎淡生熟，我今時至可遂先心。』
translation: The potter then had this thought, 'These two sons have known that salty and mild are raw and cooked, so I can come now and fulfill our former intention.'

source_sentence: 即便出家逢見故二，婦曰：『汝能棄却食嬭小兒耶？』
translation: Even after leaving home, he met his two old friends, and the woman said, 'Can you abandon your children and eat them?'

source_sentence: 夫曰：『我已試與醎淡生熟，好惡並知，方捨來此。
translation: The man said, 'I've tried cooking with salty and mild raw and cooked foods, knowing both their good and bad qualities, before I left and came here.

source_sentence: 汝既出家，我亦出家，勿生憂念。』
translation: Now that you've left home, I'll leave home, too, so don't become sad.'

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 往時陶師者豈異人乎？
translation: Wasn't the potter a different person in the past?

source_sentence: 今大迦攝波是，妻即妙賢是。
translation: Now, this is Mahākāśyapa, and his wife is Myōsan.

source_sentence: 往時二俱捨俗出家，今亦如是。」
translation: In the past, both left the secular world and left home, and now they're doing the same thing."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻復請佛言：「大德世尊！
translation: The monks then again invited the Buddha to say, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 妙賢先作何業身為金色？」
translation: What kind of karma did Myōkhyō first produce in his body that was golden?"

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「彼自作業今還自受，廣如前說。」
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "That self-proclaimed task will now be self-received, as explained in detail earlier."

source_sentence: 乃至頌曰：「假令經百劫，　　所作業不亡；　因緣會遇時，　　果報還自受。
translation: And so forth, the verse goes, "Suppose it takes a hundred eons, but the task that's been undertaken doesn't perish; when causes and conditions meet, the result is reaped again on its own.

source_sentence: 「汝等苾芻！
translation: "You monks!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔九十一劫時，有佛出世，號毘鉢尸如來等正覺，十號具足。
translation: It was long ago, during one of the 91 eons, that a Buddha appeared in the world named Vipaśyin Tathāgata and was perfectly enlightened with all 10 epithets.

source_sentence: 時有王都，王名親慧，以法化世，人民熾盛豐樂安隱，無諸詐偽賊盜疾疫，牛羊稻蔗在處充滿。
translation: At the time, there was a king's capital named Pro-Wisdom who converted the world with the Dharma, and the people were prosperous, happy, and peaceful, free of fraud, thieves, pests, and epidemics, and they were filled with cattle, sheep, and rice cane.

source_sentence: 王愍黎元猶如赤子。
translation: The king's kindness to the people was like that of a young child.

source_sentence: 其毘鉢尸佛等正覺，與六十二萬苾芻圍繞，去親慧王都不遠河邊而住。
translation: That Vipaśyin Buddha, who was perfectly enlightened, was surrounded by 620,000 monks and nuns and stayed at the river's edge not far from the capital of the king, who was close to wisdom.

source_sentence: 佛在座時，苾芻大眾威嚴尊重光彩超絕。
translation: While the Buddha was sitting there, the crowd of monks and nuns was dignified and respectful, and their radiance was extraordinary.

source_sentence: 後於異時，毘鉢尸如來遊行人間，其佛坐處遂無光彩。
translation: At some point later, the Tathāgata Vipaśyin traveled among the people, and the place where the Buddha was sitting was devoid of radiance.

source_sentence: 其時佛妹啟父王言：『大王！
translation: The Buddha's sister then revealed to her father, the king, saying, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 世尊今何處去，我願欲見。』
translation: Where's the Bhagavān going now? I'd like to see him.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『世尊遊行人間，為欲化度諸有情故。』
translation: The king said, 'The Bhagavān travels among humans because he wants to save sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 女言：『唯願父王！
translation: The woman said, 'Please, Father!

source_sentence: 以贍部金隨佛形量作等身像。』
translation: He made a life-size image of the Buddha out of gold from the Jambū River.'

source_sentence: 王即以金作像置佛坐處。
translation: The king then made an image of gold and placed it where the Buddha was sitting.

source_sentence: 佛化緣了迴至王都，佛威德故贍部金像遂失光色。
translation: After the Buddha had fulfilled the conditions for transformation, he returned to the king's capital, and the gold image of Jambū lost its luster because of the Buddha's authoritative power.

source_sentence: 妹見斯事極生奇特心懷淨信，於佛足下長跪合掌遂發願言：『如佛世尊威光神德，映此金像使無光色。
translation: Seeing this, my sister was so surprised that she had pure faith in her heart, knelt down at the Buddha's feet, put her palms together, and vowed, 'Such is the Bhagavān's authoritative and miraculous power that this gold image is devoid of radiance.

source_sentence: 從今已後，願我生生之處，身相光明與佛相似。』
translation: From now on, may I be born in a place where my physical appearance shines like that of the Buddha.'

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 昔時女者今即妙賢是，由彼往昔以清淨心發正願故，所生之處身為金色，清淨微妙光明赫弈。
translation: That woman of yore is now Myōsai, and because she made the right vow with a pure heart in the past, the body where she's born is golden, with a brilliant, pure, subtle light.

source_sentence: 汝等復觀！
translation: Again, you must examine her!

source_sentence: 至誠猛利以不壞心清淨相續，由此善根，九十一劫於上福田下勝種子，受妙果報至今不絕并得現報，於多劫中顏容端正。
translation: Being resolute and vigorous, with an indestructible mind that's pure and continuous, these good roots produced surpassing seeds in the higher fields of merit for 91 eons, which received wonderful rewards that continue to this day and have produced present rewards, and their countenance has been upright for many eons.

source_sentence: 「復次諸苾芻！
translation: "Furthermore, my fellow monks!

source_sentence: 汝等更聽妙賢曾所作業，由斯福力獲此無比端正超絕顏容金色。
translation: "Listen further, you wonderful men, to the work that you once did, which by the power of this merit gained this unsurpassed, correct, and superbly shaped face of gold.

source_sentence: 昔於婆羅痆斯城，有一長者大富多財，命其妻曰：『常辦飲食為我供養沙門婆羅門。』
translation: Once upon a time, there was an elder in Vārāṇasī who was very wealthy and had a lot of money and ordered his wife to say, 'Always prepare food and drink for me to offer to the ascetics and brāhmaṇas.'

source_sentence: 後於異時有一獨覺，身心寂靜而行乞食，入長者家。
translation: Then, at another time, there was a solitary realizer who went begging for food while his body and mind were still and entered the elder's house.

source_sentence: 妻見獨覺身不端嚴，遂不施食。
translation: Seeing that the loner's body wasn't dignified, his wife didn't give him any food.

source_sentence: 既不見與便欲出行，其婢見已請却入宅，白夫人曰：『大家何為不施食耶？』
translation: When she didn't see him, she wanted to leave. When her maid saw him, she asked him to leave and enter the house, saying to the wife, 'Why didn't you give food to him?'

source_sentence: 夫人告曰：『今此乞者身無光彩，故我不施。』
translation: The lady told him, 'Now, this beggar's body has no luster, so I won't give it to him.'

source_sentence: 婢言：『曹主豈有勅令但是醜者莫施食耶？』
translation: The maid said, 'Did Lord Cao order him not to give food to anyone who's ugly?'

source_sentence: 夫人曰：『雖無別勅，然我不與。』
translation: The woman said, 'Although I wasn't told otherwise, I won't give it to her.'

source_sentence: 婢作是念：『我寧不食，以己食分可取奉施。』
translation: The maid thought, 'I'd rather not eat than take a portion of my own food and give it to her.'

source_sentence: 即便持與。
translation: She then gave it to her.
